page.title: 01Stretham-Drained Fenland
page.content: The area is almost all under intensive cultivation. It is grade one agricultural land, predominatly peat. The village of Streatham is off the area, 1km north. The area is bisected diagonally by the embanked Old West river with its washland grazing between the flood banks and the river. The left hand squares have the main A10 fromn Cambridge to Ely, running due north along rhe line of the Old Roman Road. The pubs and a small marina are along this stretch of road. Most of the 19th Century enclosure farmhouses are now deserted.
